sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition
message_1:
Consider the system of linear equations:

$x+y+z=6$

$2x+3y+4z=20$

$4x+5y+6z=38$

Solve the system using Cholesky Decomposition.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Cholesky Decomposition, we first need to represent the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the coefficient matrix, x is the vector of variables, and b is the constant vector.

A = $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$, x = $\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix}$, b = $\begin{bmatrix} 6 \\ 20 \\ 38 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we need to decompose matrix A into the product of a lower triangular matrix L and its transpose Lᵀ: A = LLᵀ.

However, Cholesky Decomposition requires the matrix A to be symmetric and positive definite. In this case, matrix A is not symmetric, so we cannot apply Cholesky Decomposition directly.

To overcome this issue, we can multiply both sides of the equation Ax = b by Aᵀ (transpose of A) to get a new system AᵀAx = Aᵀb. The matrix AᵀA will be symmetric and positive definite, so we can apply Cholesky Decomposition to it.

Aᵀ = $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 4 \\ 1 & 3 & 5 \\ 1 & 4 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$

AᵀA = $\begin{bmatrix} 21 & 29 & 37 \\ 29 & 46 & 63 \\ 37 & 63 & 91 \end{bmatrix}$

Aᵀb = $\begin{bmatrix} 108 \\ 174 \\ 246 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we can decompose AᵀA into LLᵀ:

L = $\begin{bmatrix} \sqrt{21} & 0 & 0 \\ \frac{29}{\sqrt{21}} & \sqrt{\frac{116}{3}} & 0 \\ \frac{37}{\sqrt{21}} & \frac{10}{\sqrt{116/3}} & \sqrt{2} \end{bmatrix}$

Lᵀ = $\begin{bmatrix} \sqrt{21} & \frac{29}{\sqrt{21}} & \frac{37}{\sqrt{21}} \\ 0 & \sqrt{\frac{116}{3}} & \frac{10}{\sqrt{116/3}} \\ 0 & 0 & \sqrt{2} \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we can solve the system LLᵀx = Aᵀb in two steps:

1. Solve Ly = Aᵀb for y:

$\begin{bmatrix} \sqrt{21} & 0 & 0 \\ \frac{29}{\sqrt{21}} & \sqrt{\frac{116}{3}} & 0 \\ \frac{37}{\sqrt{21}} & \frac{10}{\sqrt{116/3}} & \sqrt{2} \end{bmatrix}$ $\begin{bmatrix} y_1 \\ y_2 \\ y_3 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 108 \\ 174 \\ 246 \end{bmatrix}$

Solving this system, we get:

y = $\begin{bmatrix} 6 \\ 4 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix}$

2. Solve Lᵀx = y for x:

$\begin{bmatrix} \sqrt{21} & \frac{29}{\sqrt{21}} & \frac{37}{\sqrt{21}} \\ 0 & \sqrt{\frac{116}{3}} & \frac{10}{\sqrt{116/3}} \\ 0 & 0 & \sqrt{2} \end{bmatrix}$ $\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 6 \\ 4 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix}$

Solving this system, we get:

x = $\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}$

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is x = 1, y = 2, and z = 3.
